#summary Syncope release notes

Syncope name and logo are about music, about expressing the mission of orchestrating data and resources: for this reason Syncope releases are named after some well-known musical terms.

= Syncope release notes =
<wiki:toc max_depth="5"/>

== 0.5.2 Crescendo (June 23rd, 2011) ==

Hello everybody!

A new maintenance release of Syncope *Crescendo*, 0.5.2, is available.

In this release:

 1. Propagation fails if !AccountId used to build !AccountLink is considered as attribute to propagate [http://code.google.com/p/syncope/issues/detail?id=122 #122]
 1. Update propagation fails if __NAME__ to be updated has the same value as remote object's [http://code.google.com/p/syncope/issues/detail?id=123 #123]
 1. Exception when paginating user list with Oracle [http://code.google.com/p/syncope/issues/detail?id=110 #110]
 1. Deleting a connector instance from the console does not work [http://code.google.com/p/syncope/issues/detail?id=119 #119]
 1. Use JNDI Datasource (when available) in ContentLoader [http://code.google.com/p/syncope/issues/detail?id=124 #124]
 1. Search user by associated resource [http://code.google.com/p/syncope/issues/detail?id=112 #112]
 1. !SchemaMapping for user propagation allows RSchema and MSchema to be selected [http://code.google.com/p/syncope/issues/detail?id=114 #114]

== 0.5.1 Crescendo (May 25th, 2011) ==

Hello everybody!

With great pleasure and pride we announce the availability of the new 0.5.1 Syncope release, *Crescendo*.

This support release includes some relevant fixes and small enhancement:

 1. REST service for getting running version [http://code.google.com/p/syncope/issues/detail?id=115 #115]
 1. Fixed an exception when restarting an instance persisted on PostgreSQL [http://code.google.com/p/syncope/issues/detail?id=116 #116]
 1. Fixed some misbehaviors introduced with JPA 2.0 [http://code.google.com/p/syncope/source/detail?r=1007]

== 0.5 (May 10th, 2011) ==

Hello everybody!

With great pleasure and pride we announce the availability of the new 0.5 Syncope release, on perfect schedule (check it on [Roadmap the roadmap]).

In a nutshell the most important new features:
 
 1. Password encryption scheme for users can now be configured [http://code.google.com/p/syncope/issues/detail?id=88 #88]
 1. The original Identity Connectors framework has been forked into the brand new !ConnId project [http://code.google.com/p/syncope/issues/detail?id=89 #89]; for more information take a look at [http://code.google.com/p/connid project website]
 1. The overall build process has been made for standard, powerful and flexible by the adoption of maven 3 [http://code.google.com/p/syncope/issues/detail?id=90 #90]
 1. A technology update has been performed in order to make Syncope compatible with J2EE 6 containers by upgrading to JPA 2.0 [http://code.google.com/p/syncope/issues/detail?id=91 #91]

Alongside with these new features, some bugfixes are also coming:
 1. [http://code.google.com/p/syncope/issues/detail?id=87 #87]
 1. [http://code.google.com/p/syncope/issues/detail?id=108 #108]
 1. [http://code.google.com/p/syncope/issues/detail?id=109 #109]
 1. [http://code.google.com/p/syncope/issues/detail?id=110 #110]

As you can check on [GettingStarted getting started page], the maven archetype has also been updated to reflect all the changes described above.


Enjoy!

The Syncope Team
